qas.question: Which early traveler provided an early description of the Rus?
What did Ahmad say about the Rus when he described clothing?

answers.text: garments that only cover half of his body

qas.question: Which historian refered to the Rus as "Scythians"?
Which late traveler provided a description of the Rus?
What covered the majority of the Rus's body?
Which scientist is refered to the Rus as "Scythians'?
What Arab historian refered to the Rus as "Scythians'?
What did the Rus adopt that was Roman?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Ahmad ibn Fadlan<b3_0/><a0_0/>, an Arab traveler during the 10th century, provided one of the earliest written descriptions of the Rus': "They are as tall as a date palm, blond and ruddy, so that they do not need to wear a tunic nor a cloak; rather the men among them wear <a1_0><b4_0>garments<b4_0/> that only cover half of his body<a1_0/> and leaves one of his hands free." Liutprand of Cremona, who was twice an envoy to the Byzantine court (949 and 968), identifies the "Russi" with the Norse ("the Russi, whom we call Norsemen by another name") but explains the name as a Greek term referring to their physical traits ("A certain people made up of a part of the Norse, whom the Greeks call [...] the Russi on account of their physical features, we designate as Norsemen because of the location of their origin."). <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>Leo the Deacon<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>, a 10th-century Byzantine historian and chronicler, refers to the Rus' as "Scythians" and notes that they tended to adopt Greek <b7_0>rituals and customs<b7_0/>.
